example.eg: I have so many favourites, it's hard to pick.
example.egtrans: 我喜欢的东西太多了，很难选。

example.eg: Brenda has to pick her favourite flavour of ice cream.
example.egtrans: 布伦达得挑最合自己口味的冰淇淋。

example.eg: Charlie likes to pick flowers for his girlfriend.
example.egtrans: 查理喜欢采花送给他女朋友。

example.eg: Doug had to pick thorns out of his trousers.
example.egtrans: 道格得拔去裤子里的刺儿。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 清除, 拔去, 剔除

example.eg: David always picks fights at school.
example.egtrans: 大卫在学校总是找茬打架。

example.eg: Please stop picking quarrels with your sister.
example.egtrans: 拜托，不要再跟你妹妹故意吵架了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 挑起与...的争端, 故意与...争吵

example.eg: The home team has the first pick.
example.egtrans: 主队先选。

example.eg: That wouldn't be everyone's pick, but I guess you know what you like.
example.egtrans: 你的选择跟大多数人的不一样，但我想，你喜欢什么，自己最清楚。

example.eg: He used a pick to remove a chunk of rock from the cliff face.
example.egtrans: 他用一把镐子敲掉了崖面上的一块石头。

example.eg: Alex strummed his guitar with a pick.
example.egtrans: 艾利克斯用拨片漫不经心地弹奏吉他。

example.eg: The dentist used a pick to clean the teeth.
example.egtrans: 牙医用一根牙签来清理牙齿。

example.eg: The guard used a pick to stop the forward.
example.egtrans: 后卫用挡差的方式阻止前锋的进攻。

example.eg: Are you going to eat, or just pick?
example.egtrans: 你到底要吃饭还是要挑挑拣拣？

trans_examp.trans_cn: 一点一点慢慢地吃, 无精打采地吃, 挑挑拣拣地吃

example.eg: My uncle picks a banjo.
He picked the rock carefully in order to remove the fossil.
The cat burglar picked the lock.
Edith just picked at her food.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 慢慢地吃, 细嚼慢咽

example.eg: Her mother was always picking at her about her appearance.
The police sniper picked off the bank robbers one by one.
example.egtrans: 警方的狙击手瞄准那伙银行抢劫犯，将其逐个瞄准射杀。

example.eg: Please don't pick on me because I'm small!
example.egtrans: 请不要因为我身材矮小就来招惹我！

trans_examp.trans_cn: 招惹, 故意找茬, 欺负

example.eg: They've gone to pick out her engagement ring.
example.egtrans: 他们去挑选她的订婚戒指了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 挑出，挑选, 辨认出, 辨认出

example.eg: The professor picked Ken out as his research assistant.
example.egtrans: 教授挑中肯作为自己的研究助理。

example.eg: The woman picked out the thief in an identity parade.
example.egtrans: 那位女子在列队辨认嫌疑犯时认出了小偷。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 分辨出, 识别出, 认出

example.eg: Mrs. Arnolds picked over the barrel of apples to find the juiciest ones.
I'll pick up the kids from school today.
Could you pick up my prescription on your way past the chemist?
I picked up the book which had fallen onto the floor.
Lisa picked some guy up in a bar last night.
We hope that sales will pick up next month.
I let the phone ring for ages but he didn't pick up.

dsense.name: pick [sth] up, pick up [sth]
dsense.guideword: figurative, informal (acquire: a habit, mannerism) (习惯，言谈举止)

example.eg: Maria was worried that her son was picking up some bad habits from the other boys at school.

dsense.name: pick [sth] up, pick up [sth]
dsense.guideword: figurative, informal (learn: a language, skill) (语言，技能)

example.eg: My brother is so good at languages, he picked up French in a week.

dsense.name: pick [sth] up, pick up [sth]
dsense.guideword: figurative, informal (learn over time, bit by bit)

example.eg: Andy picked up his cookery skills while working in his father's restaurant.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 逐渐学会, 一点一点地学会

example.eg: The security scanner picked up something strange.
example.egtrans: 安检仪检测到可疑的物品。

example.eg: I made an error in my calculations, but nobody picked up on it.
example.egtrans: 我的计算中有一处错误，不过没有人注意到。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 注意到，发现, 重新回到（已提到过的要点）

example.eg: Denise picked up on Laura's comment about working mothers.
example.egtrans: 丹妮丝重新谈到劳拉关于要上班的母亲的评论。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 重新谈到（已提到过的要点）

example.eg: He cherry-picked the data to support his point of view.
The manager handpicked Charlotte for the position because of her extensive experience.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 亲自挑选, 细心挑选

dsense.name: have a bone to pick with [sb]

example.eg: I have a bone to pick with you! Did you forget to feed the cat?
Salad bars allow customers to pick and choose from a wide selection of vegetables.
The hyenas picked the bones clean.
example.egtrans: 鬣狗把骨头啃得干干净净。

example.eg: The boy picked the grapes off the vine and ate them one by one.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 挑毛病，挑错, 找茬儿

dsense.name: pick it up
dsense.guideword: informal (move, work, etc., at a faster rate)

example.eg: We'll never finish this job by Thursday at this rate; we need to pick it up.
I still don't understand why she picked him over me.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 选择...而不选..., 选择...而非...

dsense.name: pick pockets, pick [sb]'s pockets, pick [sb]'s pocket

example.eg: The thief picked the passengers' pockets.
The thieves picked the lock on the door to get inside the house.
Fiona picked up the phone and began talking to someone on the other end.
After her husband's death, she had to pick up the pieces the best she could.
Mozart picked up the torch passed to him from Haydn, and elevated classical music to new heights.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 接过接力棒，继续前人的事业

example.eg: Can I pick your brain for a minute?
Little kids will pick their noses in public, because they have no shame.
The survivors picked their way through the wreckage.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 小心翼翼地穿过, 择路而行

dsense.name: pick-me-up
dsense.guideword: informal ([sth] that makes you feel better)

example.eg: When I need a little pick-me-up, I eat one of my favorite candy bars.
The man gave us a ride in the back of his pickup.
example.egtrans: 那位男子让我们坐到他皮卡的后车厢里载了我们一程。

example.eg: "Do you come here often?" is not a very original pickup line, to say the least.

dsense.name: pickup truck, pick-up truck, pickup, pick-up

example.eg: My new pickup truck is painted bright yellow.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 敞蓬小型载货卡车, 轻型货车, 皮卡

example.eg: You want to borrow a dress? Sure, have a look in my wardrobe and take your pick.
